name: mysql_field_flags
purpose: Get the flags associated with the specified field in a result

return.description:
Returns a string of flags associated with the result or FALSE on failure.The following flags are reported, if your version of MySQL
   is current enough to support them: "not_null", 
   "primary_key", "unique_key", 
   "multiple_key", "blob", 
   "unsigned", "zerofill",
   "binary", "enum", 
   "auto_increment" and "timestamp".

notes.description:
For backward compatibility, the following
deprecated alias may be used: 
    mysql_fieldflags
